I used to spend many afternoons hanging out in the best book shop in the city, getting all the best tips from Peter B (RIP) who ran the shop. Being the quintessential salesman-who-never-sold, Peter was well connected with his clientele, and passed on my name to the CD at GBP, Ron Weidemann. This was in 2000."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/callumflack/Repos/t-tw/apps/web/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-e9484af0-640e-4850-abaa-e38b30d90533.mdx",lineNumber:15,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,p.jsxDEV)(i.p,{children:"One of my initial projects for Ron was to redesign the Breaka Milk brand. I remember sitting in the presentation meeting to present my work feeling quite out-of-place in my skateboarding sneakers amongst the suits. The graphics were a hit and I was given the green light to redesign the brand and packaging."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/callumflack/Repos/t-tw/apps/web/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-e9484af0-640e-4850-abaa-e38b30d90533.mdx",lineNumber:17,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,p.jsxDEV)(i.p,{children:"I redrew the logotype by hand, adding wave devices. `,(0,p.jsxDEV)(i.p,{children:"While at GPB, I also did 3 consecutive outdoor campaigns for Pauls Milk featuring Pat Rafter, right at his peak. While I thought it a little too easy to rip off Reid Miles, getting away with this kind of white space in Australian advertising at the turn of the century was an achievement in itself."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/callumflack/Repos/t-tw/apps/web/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-e9484af0-640e-4850-abaa-e38b30d90533.mdx",lineNumber:39,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,p.jsxDEV)(i.p,{children:"I'm also still fond of this campaign for Brisbane Arcade. Aggressively lean and simple, it was a great example of how to make a little go a long way.
